original: Bergendahl, Olof, civilingenjör, Göteborg, f. 17/2/73 i Gbg av musikförest. v. Göta art:reg. Axel B. o. Henrietta Edström. G. 03 m. Louise Mül-’ler. Barn: Lo’lo f. 04, g. m. köpm. Alf Klevner, Gbg, Nancy 05, g. m. köpm. Ture Swensson, Gbg, Olof 07, marin dir., S’tMmi, g. m. Britta Jakobson, Britt 30. — Ex. v. CTI 92. Anst. v. flera istörre föret, i Sv:e o. uti. Grund, ing:- o. hand: firman 0’lof B^rgendahl i Gbg 16, inineh. av denna. Fd. öve-rlär. v. Siöjdfören. sikoila i Gbg ett f.lertal år. Ordf. i Sv. Elektr. Entrepren :fören., Gbg, v. ordf. i överstyr, f. Elektr. Entrepren :fören. o. Elektr. Arbetsgiv:-fören.
translated: Bergendahl, Olof, engineer, Gothenburg, born February 17, 1873 in Gothenburg to music director of West Gothia Artillery Regiment Axel B. and Henrietta Edström. Married in 1903 to Louise Müller. Children: Lolo, born in 1904, married to merchant Alf Klevner from Gothenburg; Nancy, born in 1905, married to merchant Ture Swensson from Gothenburg; Olof, born in 1907, navy director in Stockholm, married to Britta Jakobson; and Britt, born in 1930. Examined at the Chalmers University of Technology in 1892. Employed by several major companies in Sweden and abroad. Founded engineering and trading company Olof Bergendahl in Gothenburg in 1916 and was managing director of it. Former instructor at the Swedish Maritime Association School in Gothenburg for several years. Chairman of the Swedish Electric Contractor Association in Gothenburg, Vice Chairman of the Board of the Electric Contractor Association, and the Electrical Employers' Association.
